title: World War I
text: A global war originating in Europe that lasted from 1914 to 1918, involving many of the world's great powers.

title: World War II
text: A global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945, involving most of the world's nations, including all of the great powers.

title: Cold War
text: A period of geopolitical tension between the Soviet Union and the United States and their respective allies after World War II, lasting from 1947 to 1991.

title: Napoleonic Wars
text: A series of major conflicts pitting the French Empire, led by Napoleon Bonaparte, against various European coalitions from 1803 to 1815.

title: Vietnam War
text: A conflict in Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia from 1955 to 1975, involving North Vietnam and its allies against South Vietnam and its principal ally, the United States.

title: Korean War
text: A war between North Korea and South Korea from 1950 to 1953, with major involvement from the United States and China.
